turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Victoria Drummond.
turn.1: What was the Victoria Drummond's promise?
turn.2: Wortley offered Drummond the promise of a position as an engineer at sea when she completed her apprenticeship.
turn.3: Did she take up the offer?
turn.4: When Caledon gave her notice in 1922, Drummond wrote to Wortley to take up his offer.
turn.5: What did she do at sea?
turn.6: Unknown to Drummond, Wortley had died in 1919.
turn.7: Did anyone else offer her the position?
turn.8: However, Lawrence Holt honoured Wortley's promise and invited her to Liverpool for an interview.
turn.9: What did she do in liverpool?
turn.10: Blue Funnel employed Drummond initially in its engineering record office in Liverpool on a salary of £12 a month.
turn.12: About a month later, on 25 August, she was instructed to sign on the passenger liner for a trial trip from Liverpool to Glasgow as an Assistant Engineer.
